question.text: Consider an electromagnetic wave propagating in vacuum. Choose the correct statement:

options.text: For an electromagnetic wave propagating in <math><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi></math> direction the electric field is <math><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mi>z</mi></mrow></msub><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover></math> and the magnetic field is <math><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></msub><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover></math>

For an electromagnetic wave propagating in + y direction the electric field is  <math><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mi>z</mi></mrow></msub><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover></math> and the magnetic field is <math><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>yz</mi></mrow></msub><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover></math>

For an electromagnetic wave propagating in + x direction the electric field is <math><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mi>z</mi></mrow></msub><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>,</mo><mi> </mi><mi>z</mi><mo>,</mo><mi> </mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mi> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math> and the magnetic field is <math><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mi>z</mi></mrow></msub><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>,</mo><mi> </mi><mi>z</mi><mo>,</mo><mi> </mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mi> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math>

For an electromagnetic wave propagating in + x direction the electric field is <math><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mi>z</mi></mrow></msub><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mi> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>-</mo><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math> and the magnetic field is <math><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mi> </mi><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mi>z</mi></mrow></msub><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi> </mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow><mo>^</mo></mover></mrow></mfenced></math>

solution.text:
Wave in x - direction means E→ and B→ should be function of x and t

y^-z^⊥y^+z^

E→ ×B→|| x^
